results.title: Introducing music: the instruments of the orchestra
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Open University and Brian Large
results.brief_description: A film of a musical performance in which almost all the instruments of the symphony orchestra, plus others in current use today, are seen and heard in close-up. The music was composed by John Dankworth, who also conducts the orchestra and plays the saxophone. It has been ingeniously written, not only to give each instrument its moment of personal display, but to allow for frequent quieter moments during which a narration introduces the instruments and the techniques of the players.
results.title_for_label: Introducing music: the instruments of the orchestra

results.title: Introducing multimedia (MAC & PC)
results.brief_description: The Australian Government is promoting informed debate about the opportunities and challenges arising from the convergence of information technology, broadcasting and telecommunications. ‘Introducing multimedia’ provides background information to assist consideration of the industrial, social, and cultural issues arising from technical convergence. The programme consists of three parts: an executive summary, general information about the emerging multimedia industry and details of the use of this technology within a variety of industries in various markets. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: This program was designed to run on Macintosh and Windows operating systems. For Windows, at least 5MB of memory is needed to run this program. Mac uses 2.4 MB on disk. Suggested size: 1050K, minimum size: 800K, preferred size: 4696K.

results.title: Introducing insects
results.brief_description: A veritable who’s who of the insect world, this film ushers you into a wonderland of nature for an absorbing study of creatures more colorful and quite as complex as much larger forms of animal life. Microcinematography, slow-motion and time-lapse, reveal startling sequences in insect development.

results.title: Introducing globes. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and John Lord
results.brief_description: Animation and live-action are combined to explain many ways a globe can be used to help develop an understanding of the earth. Introduces concepts of latitude, longitude and rotation and notes the advantages of globes over flat maps. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Introducing East Africa
results.brief_description: A survey of changes which have taken place during 50 years of British rule in East Africa. Includes modern farming methods, introduction of cattle raising and industry, water conservation, the construction of schools and colleges and hospitals, nurses and doctors bringing health to the people of the land.

results.title: Introducing diffusion bonding
results.brief_description: One of a series of films to demonstrate the industrial potential of the results from research into the process of diffusion bonding. Intended for designers, metallurgists, welding, production and planning engineers and advanced students familiar with welding processes

results.title: Introducing badminton
results.creator_credit: Sports Films, Mike Goodwin and Gillian Gilks
results.brief_description: A coaching film which shows how to execute all the basic strokes of the game, badminton, and explains the basic tactics for singles, men’s doubles and mixed doubles. Intended for sports centres, schools and colleges.

results.title: Introducing Australian football [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Frank Bagnall and Malcolm Smith
results.brief_description: The Victorian Football League’s 1972 Grand Final, between the Carlton and Richmond teams is the dramatic background used to explain the rules and techniques of play. Includes slow-motion and free-frame techniques, playing positions, rules, penaltiesand the five types of kick employed. Commentary in Italian.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Frank Bagnall and Malcolm Smith
